intro: Aulomyrcia egensis, commonly known as the Egyptian sand thorn, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Egypt. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and woody, thorny stems. The plant thrives in sandy and rocky soils, often found in desert and semi-desert environments. Its leaves are typically small and scale-like, reducing water loss in its harsh habitat. Aulomyrcia egensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small desert animals.
